p: Among the green technologies, pressurized liquid extraction (PLE), also called accelerated solvent extraction (ASE), is a fully automated technique that combines high temperature and pressure with the use of liquid solvents. This technique proved efficient to extract different matrices such as food [ 219] medicinal plants [ 220], and environmental samples [ 221]. PLE improves extraction yield, significantly reducing time and solvent consumption, [ 222] and it can be used to extract molecules of different polarity, such as phenolic compounds, carotenoids, and essential oils [ 222]. An optimized PLE protocol for the extraction of water-soluble molecules is represented by hydrothermal extraction, which uses water at high temperature and high pressure and has been employed to extract spent coffee grounds [ 223].
